text.p: The following are some of the top headlines in leading Italian newspapers.

* Former star anti-graft magistarate Antonio Di Pietro defended his decision to run for Senate for the governing centre-left Olive Tree coalition. He said he would withdraw his candidacy if magistrates investigating his involvement in a corruption scandal ask for an indictment.
* Murdered fashion designer Gianni Versace's ashes were due to return to Italy on Friday after a cremation service in Miami Beach.
* Foreign buying pushed Italian stocks to a record high again on Thursday with the historic Mib index finishing the day at 14.825 points and the Comit index at 922.68 points. (all)

* Treasury Minister Carlo Azeglio Ciampi said a fall in Italy's public deficit had pushed Italian stocks up. He also denied any Franco-German plot to exclude Italy from the first wave of entry to Europe's planned single currency in 1999. (La Repubblica/La Stampa)
* The Italian regions have spent only 30 billion lire of a 500-billion lire fund set aside for investment projects. (Sole 24 Ore)
** Reuters has not verified these stories and cannot vouch for their accuracy.
